text: "It really delved into a lot of issues that women are dealing with daily that we don't often see on-screen in this way," Witherspoon, 40, said on a recent weekday in Pasadena. "And it's not black and white. These aren't women who are good or bad. We wanted to show the rainbow of the female experience, which I think is sort of absent in Hollywood in a lot of ways."
